results.title: Robert Klippel drawings, 1947-1963
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: A succession of the drawings of the Australian sculptor, Robert Klippel, covering the period from 1947-1963. Shows the development of the creative talent - an exploration of the mind of a fascinating man, the things which inspired him and the many strange, abstract drawings which were the result of his experiences in Australia and overseas. The commentary is by Klippel himself. Music by Larry Sitsky.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Notes on the passage of time
results.brief_description: A three colour separation study filmed at Pearl Beach, which examines the same scene of Amethyst Avenue during the progression of a winter, then a summer day. With the sea in the background, the moving objects such as the pedestrians, cyclists, traffic are transparent and ephemeral while the stationary objects are opaque and retain a permanent quality. A strange, almost surreal quality illustrating the transitional nature of life.

results.title: Mud
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: An experimental film. Close shots of a bubbling pool of thermal mud in New Zealand are matched to primeval sounds evoking the creation of a world. The sounds are composed of plucked piano bass strings, especially recorded to capture reverberation, slowed-down cymbals, xylophone, wobble board and castanets.

results.title: Moving statics
results.brief_description: An attempt to transfer the abstract kinetic art of the Dutch mime, Will Spoor, to the screen, using techniques of animation, superimposition, and film speed and exposure changes to create new patterns of body movement. Made in London, 1969. Commentary by Will Spoor.

results.title: Kinegraffiti
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: Experimental film using fireworks, often superimposed and in soft focus, printed in negative form with a black image on a white background. Plucked piano strings reversed xylophone and cymbal with an electronic vibrato effect form the background sound effects.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Island fuse
results.brief_description: An experimental film in which the filmmakers are concerned with the experience of filming: the interaction between projected image, screen, camera, projector, light and filters. Old b&w documentary footage was reworked in colour, by refilming from a rear projector screen.
results.description: An experimental film in which the filmmakers are concerned with the experience of filming: the interaction between projected image, screen, camera, projector, light and filters. Old b&w documentary footage was reworked in colour, by refilming from a rear projector screen.

results.title: The Incised image
results.brief_description: A film on the work of Charles Lloyd showing in detail the dry-point technique of etching and the possibilities of one-plate colour printing which he studied at Atelier 17 in Paris. Culminates in an animated sequence interpreting his statement - “each print is an adventure, a little journey of discovery”. The commentary is edited from his recorded discussions.

results.title: Henri Gaudier-Brzeska
results.brief_description: A documentary on the sculptures and drawings of the young Vorticist sculptor who was killed in World War I at the age of 23. The film emphasises Gaudier-Brzeska’s involvement with the Vorticist movement and Ezra Pound. Gaudier-Brzeska’s statements on sculpture are drawn from his extensive correspondence and contributions to “Blast”, the vorticist magazine. Much of the narration is drawn from the artists writings on his art.

results.title: Glove puppetry - Scenery and production
results.brief_description: Final film in the series devoted to “Creative Leisure’. The children see the culmination of their work then they assemble scenery and puppets for the staging of their play. The children paint the backdrop and throne; gather leaves and stalks for scenery; and make baskets, fishing line, and table as props before staging their puppet play “Snow White and Rose Red.”

results.title: Glove puppetry - Painting and dressing
results.brief_description: Children paint and dress their own puppets at the Brisbane Creative Leisure Centre. The puppets being to come to life as colourful expressions are painted on, wigs added, and a strip of glue felted around the neck. Using a paper pattern, clothes are cut out, and then sewn strongly together.
